items.summary: Bankrupt auto supplier First Brands Group is seeking to raise new financing backed by receivables invoices, reviving a tool that was once crucial to its operations but also had a hand in its demise.

items.summary: Insatiable demand for everything AI has driven up Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.’s share price, but that’s put some fund managers at risk of underperforming due to restrictions on portfolio concentration.

items.summary: Bets for South Korean stock swings have surged, raising concerns over the rally in this year’s best-performing market.

items.summary: FDA names longtime cancer scientist Pazdur to lead drug center

items.title: Treasury Futures Rally, Dollar Falls on Gloomy US Jobs Picture
items.summary: Treasury futures jumped and the dollar slid after private-sector employment figures from ADP Research signaled a slowing US jobs market amid the longest government shutdown on record.

items.title: Yamaha launches two new motorcycles, unveils first electric scooters in India
items.summary: Yamaha Motor India has expanded its portfolio with the launch of two new motorcycles — the Yamaha FZ RAVE and Yamaha XSR 155, along with the unveiling of its first-ever electric scooters, the Yamaha Aerox E and Yamaha E-06.

items.title: India-Russia summit to boost small nuclear reactors, localisation
items.summary: India and Russia are set to significantly expand their civil nuclear cooperation. The upcoming 23rd annual summit will focus on small and modular reactors and increasing local production of nuclear plant equipment. Discussions also covered progress at the Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant and future large and small-scale projects. This collaboration aims to strengthen energy ties between the two nations.

items.title: India may push 5-MT green hydrogen target to FY32 amid global policy delays
items.summary: Sarangi cited policy uncertainties in Europe, a major potential export destination, the International Maritime Organisation (IMO's) deferral of its green fuel mandate by a year, and delay in implementation of 'Renewable Energy Directive-3' of the European Union, as key reasons for the expected delay. "Some of the decisions by the industry have also been deferred. Not all companies will defer," Sarangi said on the sidelines of the International Conference on Green Hydrogen.

items.title: IndusInd Bank may put former execs in the dock, claw back bonuses
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) November 2019 guidelines on the compensation of key managerial personnel direct banks to establish a clawback mechanism for variable pay to address misconduct risk and ensure compliance with all relevant statutory and regulatory requirements. The clawback clauses feature in the employment contracts of the executives concerned, allowing the bank to launch recovery of compensation in cases of proven misconduct or violations of company policy, said  officials in the know.

items.title: GAIL chief's dissent note shows rift in PNGRB gas reform panel
items.summary: The panel on boosting domestic gas use has proposed major reforms—lifting LNG resale limits, creating an independent pipeline operator, real-time booking system, CNG excise removal, pipeline funding, PNG subsidies, and GST inclusion at a lower rate.

items.title: Aim to make India global hub for green hydrogen production: Pralhad Joshi
items.summary: The cost of solar power in India is among the lowest in the world, and with rapidly expanding wind and hydro projects, the country is building a clean energy base that will drive the next great industrial revolution - the hydrogen revolution. So far, under the mission, incentives have been awarded for 3,000 MW per year of domestic electrolyser manufacturing capacity and 8.62 lakh metric tonnes per year of green hydrogen production.

items.title: Digital thrust for Urban Cooperative Banks to enhance efficiency
items.summary: DigiPay will help improve profitability of UCBs, as it will bring down their Unified Payment Interface, or UPI, transaction costs, reducing switch charges to between ₹0.01 and ₹3, as against ₹0.50 and ₹5, said chief executive of NUCFDC, Prabhat Chaturvedi. DigiLoan introduces a digital loan origination system that lets UCBs process, verify, and sanction loans online.

items.title: OECD panel flags excess steel supplies; China exports surge
items.summary: In August, the Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) under the Commerce Ministry, India, recommended a final imposition of safeguard duty on certain flat steel imports, with the trade body suggesting a staggered rate of 12%, 11.5% and 11% for the next three years.However, the steel industry has raised concerns about the quantum of safeguard duty being inadequate to check imports. The steel players have sought a safeguard duty of 25% to restrict imports from China effectively.

items.title: Centre to dissolve Gati Shakti’s Network Planning Group, set up unified transport planning body
items.summary: The idea is to have a structured framework for master planning of transport development in the country and have a data repository that can help in future planning and policy interventions. To be created on the lines of similar unified institutions in the US, UK and Germany, the Indian entity will come up with comprehensive, long-term strategies for transport-related sectors to reduce costs, increase efficiency, and promote integrated multimodal corridors.

items.title: Stocks to Watch Today (November 12, 2025): HAL, Asian Paints, Tata Power, Bharat Forge, PowerGrid, Allcargo Logistics and more
items.summary: Stocks to Watch Today (November 12, 2025): Dalal Street will track key Q2 results from nearly 600 companies, including Asian Paints, Tata Steel, Ashok Leyland, HAL, IRCTC, Prestige Estates Projects, and IGL. Several stocks are due to trade ex-dividend or ex-spin-off, including Allcargo Gati, Allcargo Logistics, Gujarat Pipavav Port, Kaveri Seed, Sagility and Symphony.

items.title: Adani plans India's biggest battery storage in Gujarat
items.summary: Slated for commissioning by March, the project will be India's largest and among the world's biggest single-location BESS deployments, involving more than 700 BESS containers.

items.title: India-US trade talks near final stage, says Piyush Goyal: Government aims for fair, balanced deal
items.summary: India and the US are close to finalising a comprehensive Bilateral Trade Agreement aimed at ensuring fair and balanced outcomes. Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said national interest remains central as tariff tensions ease and talks move towards closure.

items.title: JSW may sell 50% in Bhushan Power to JFE
items.summary: JSW Steel is considering selling half of its stake in Bhushan Power and Steel. Japanese firm JFE Steel Corp is reportedly leading the race to acquire this stake. The deal, valued at approximately ₹15,000-16,000 crore, is expected to be finalized by December. This move follows the Supreme Court's clearance of Bhushan Power's resolution plan.

items.title: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation bats for replacing closed units in IIP Index
items.summary: Under the proposed methodology, inactive units would be substituted with active ones that have at least 12 months of overlapping data to ensure continuity and comparability, according to a discussion paper released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI) on Tuesday.

items.title: Delhi High Court restrains Patanjali from airing Chyawanprash Ad
items.summary: Justice Tejas Karia ordered Patanjali to take down the advertisement from all electronic media, including national TV channels, OTT platforms or any streaming systems, and from all digital and print media within three days. The judge was hearing a plea by Dabur India, which alleged that Patanjali's advertisement aired last month had disparaged its chyawanprash product.

items.title: From prime time to playtime: Nazara Technologies, TMKOC & other entertainment companies chase mobile gamers
items.summary: Popular Indian entertainment franchises are now entering the mobile gaming world. Shows like Bigg Boss and Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah, along with animated characters like Chhota Bheem, are being adapted into games. This move aims to keep audiences engaged and create new revenue streams. Experts see this as a significant shift in how content is monetized and experienced.

items.title: Banks and NBFCs step up stressed asset sales to clean up books
items.summary: Lenders aggressively sold bad loans in the September quarter. Retail bad loan sales nearly doubled. Corporate bad loan sales also saw a significant increase. This move reflects a focus on cleaning balance sheets. The trend is expected to continue in upcoming quarters. Asset reconstruction companies are adapting to this shift.

items.title: India, New Zealand near trade pact
items.summary: India is nearing the finalization of a trade pact with New Zealand, with Trade Minister Todd McClay scheduled to visit India this Friday. Discussions with the EU are also progressing, and Trade Commissioner Maros Šefovi is expected in mid-December. Additionally, the GCC, Bahrain, Qatar, and Israel have expressed interest in trade agreements.

items.title: Heineken says nuclear families driving demand for beer; eyes youth, urban middle-class
items.summary: Heineken's CEO identifies India's shift to nuclear families as a key driver for its growing beer market. This societal change fosters greater social freedom, accelerating beer adoption among a young, urbanizing population. With millions entering legal drinking age annually, India presents a significant global opportunity for beer consumption.

items.title: Boeing says tariff issues won't hit its India business, gears up to increase investments in the country
items.summary: Boeing India asserts that its operations will remain unaffected by US-India trade frictions, advocating for a zero-tariff environment in aerospace and defense. The company plans further investments in India, including a pilot training facility and enhanced local maintenance capabilities, aligning with the 'Make in India' initiative.

items.title: IFC commits $100 million to Everstone Capital's new fund
items.summary: The remainder will be for co-investments by IFC and Everstone. Singapore-headquartered Everstone Capital has funds under management of $8 billion. It invests in mid-market companies in healthcare, pharmaceutical, tech and business services, consumer, financial services, and industrial sectors.

items.title: Vodafone Idea's falling capex raises red flags on network growth
items.summary: The company's net loss narrowed to ₹5,560 crore from ₹6,610 crore in the previous quarter, primarily driven by lower interest charges. Revenue increased 2.4% year-on-year to ₹11,190 crore, while earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortisation (EBITDA) increased 3% to ₹4,690 crore with margins stable at 41.9%. According to UBS, the net loss was lower than its estimated loss of ₹6,700 crore due to lower than expected interest charges.

items.title: Belgium to share past financial data with India under revised tax treaty
items.summary: Some of the stipulations of the amended treaty are: a contracting state cannot decline to supply information solely because it has no domestic interest in such information; information cannot be held back on the grounds that it is held by a bank or financial institution or nominees or person acting in a fiduciary capacity; and, the state which receives request or tax claim must take "measures conservancy" - like freezing assets - even if it is owed by a person who has the right to prevent its collection.

items.title: Yamaha bets on premium, electric push for India turnaround
items.summary: Yamaha Motor aims for a comeback in India by focusing on premium motorcycles and scooters. The company will launch ten new models, including two electric scooters, over the next year. Yamaha is targeting growth in the 149-155cc motorcycle segment and increasing exports. The company will also enter the electric vehicle market with a premium strategy, collaborating with River.

Essential items are now more affordable, with sales of air conditioners and televisions doubling and tripling respectively.

"As we move towards Viksit Bharat 2047, let's aim for our own robust credible world class rating institution from India," he said here at CareEdge Global-The Dialogue. He said that credit rating agencies have an important role in the virtuous cycle of growth.

items.title: India set to miss 2030 hydrogen goal due to demand uncertainty

However, hurdles such as geopolitical tensions and US tariffs are looming.

items.summary: Sure, artificial intelligence can make life simpler by suggesting you places to eat, tell you weather, or even crack a joke.
